alert.note: Alert for Eastern Louisa; Goochland; Western Hanover (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 5:52PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Louisa, central Goochland and northwestern Hanover Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 552 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gum Spring, or near Hadensville, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Gum Spring around 600 PM EDT. Oilville around 620 PM EDT. Montpelier and Wyndham around 630 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Orchid, Sandy Hook, Vontay, Coatesville, Johnsons Springs, Goodall, Mabelton, Noel, Cuckoo and Rockville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
